title: New orbit after burst of the ship's engine

content.question: A spacecraft orbits Earth in a circular orbit of radius R, as shown above. When the spacecraft is at position P shown, a short burst of the ship's engines results in a small increase in its speed. The new orbit is best shown by the solid curve in which of the following diagrams?

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown, each with a circle representing the earth at the center and a dashed circle around and concentric with the earth. The lowest point on the dashed circle is P and there is an arrow indicating clockwise motion. Choice A has a solid circle concentric with and between the earth and the dashed circle, with an arrow indicating clockwise motion.

Five answer choices are shown, each with a circle representing the earth at the center and a dashed circle around and concentric with the earth. The lowest point on the dashed circle is P and there is an arrow indicating clockwise motion. Choice B has a solid circle concentric with the earth and the dashed circle and larger than the dashed circle, with an arrow indicating clockwise motion.

Five answer choices are shown, each with a circle representing the earth at the center and a dashed circle around and concentric with the earth. The lowest point on the dashed circle is P and there is an arrow indicating clockwise motion. Choice C has a solid vertical ellipse touching the dashed circle at point P but between the earth and the dashed circle at all other points, with an arrow indicating clockwise motion.

Five answer choices are shown, each with a circle representing the earth at the center and a dashed circle around and concentric with the earth. The lowest point on the dashed circle is P and there is an arrow indicating clockwise motion. Choice D has a solid vertical ellipse touching the dashed circle at point P but outside the dashed circle at all other points, with an arrow indicating clockwise motion.
